HIGH: Obeys at least 70% of the time
MEDIUM: Obeys AT LEAST 30% of the time
LOW: Obeys LESS THAN 30% of the time
HIGH: Requires a training frequency of LESS than 16 repetitions
MEDIUM: Requires a training frequency of 16 to 40 repetitions
LOW: Requires a training frequency of MORE than 40 repetitions
HIGH: Rarely loses fur
MEDIUM: Loses fur periodically or seasonally
LOW: Loses fur majority of the time
HIGH: Drooling never or rarely happens
MEDIUM: Drooling sometimes occurs seasonally or in certain conditions
LOW: Drooling occurs frequently
HIGH: Once a month
MEDIUM: Twice a month
LOW: More than twice a month
HIGH: Generally friendly; generally does not bark if there is no provocative action
MEDIUM: Might bark at unfamiliar subject
LOW: Very reactive to unfamiliar subjects
HIGH: Can adapt well; easily connects with humans
MEDIUM: Might need time to make new relationships with humans
LOW: Needs a lot of time to build new relationships; may seem uncomfortable until then
HIGH: Highly adaptable; can live with other pets without problems
MEDIUM: Can adapt well with certain pets or the same species, but can behave differently towards others
LOW: Reluctant to be friends with other pets; prefers to be alone
HIGH: Highly adaptable to various environmental conditions; has high tolerance for weather changes
MEDIUM: Can still adapt well to certain environmental conditions but sometimes need humans to adapt
LOW: Needs a certain environmental condition to live well and is very dependent on humans to adapt
HIGH: Very popular dog breed; ranks between 1 to 25
MEDIUM: Moderately popular dog breed; ranks between 26 to 100
LOW: Less popular dog breed; ranks below 100
HIGH: Long lifespan or a young pup
MEDIUM: Average lifespan or a mature dog
LOW: Senior or geriatric dog
Obedience refers to how well or how often the dog successfully follows commands given by its adopter or handler at a given time.
Trainability refers to how well the dog learns commands through repetitions.
Non-Shedding refers to how rarely the dog sheds its fur naturally.
Non-Drooling refers to how rarely the dog drools.
Ease of Care refers to how rarely the dog requires additional or extra care beyond normal (nail care, advanced grooming, or any other specialized treatment).
Friendliness refers to how friendly the dog is with humans and other animals.
Adaptability to Humans refers to how well the dog adapts to new encounters with humans.
Adaptability to Other Pets refers to how well the dog adapts to new encounters with other pets.
Adaptability to Environment refers to how well the dog adapts to environmental conditions and changes.
Popularity refers to how popular the dog is, based on the American Kennel Club List of breed popularity.
Longevity refers to how many more years the dog is expected to live.
With respect to Obedience under Intelligence
With respect to Trainability under Intelligence
With respect to Non-Shedding under Hygiene
With respect to Non-Drooling under Hygiene
With respect to Ease of Care
With respect to Friendliness

With respect to Adaptability to Other Pets
With respect to Adaptability to Environment
With respect to Popularity
With respect to Longevity
HIGH: Strongly enjoys playing; is easily excited
MEDIUM: Is fond of physical activity at times
LOW: Cat is sedentary
HIGH: Relaxed; is not easily agitated
MEDIUM: Often restless; gets scared moderately easily
LOW: Exhibits extreme signs of fearful behavior (e.g. growls, hisses, hiding)
HIGH: Affectionate; is rarely rough
MEDIUM: Prone to be aggressive
LOW: Habitually or highly likely to scratch, bite, or hiss
HIGH: Connects and interacts well with humans
MEDIUM: Reacts and is somewhat friendly
LOW: Tends to be aloof or indifferent
HIGH: Enjoys and seeks to be with other pets
MEDIUM: Fairly sociable with other pets; sometimes acts indifferent
LOW: Has difficulty getting along with other pets
HIGH: Potty-trained; adapts well to its litter box
MEDIUM: Has excretory quirks and might be picky with the litter box
LOW: May need extra time or training to get used to the litter box
HIGH: Grooms regularly
MEDIUM: Does moderate grooming
LOW: May do intensive, harmful, or mutilating grooming
HIGH: More than 14 years left to live
MEDIUM: 6 to 13 years left to live
LOW: Has LESS than 6 years left to live
HIGH: Very popular breed; ranks between 1 to 10
MEDIUM: Moderately popular breed; ranks between 11 to 25
LOW: Less popular breed; ranks below 25
Activity/Playfulness refers to how energetic, mischievous, and active the cat is.
Calmness refers to how calm the cat is in general.
Non-Aggression refers to the lack of aggressive behavior in a cat.
Sociability to Humans refers to how friendly and affectionate a cat is towards humans, whether strangers or companions.
Sociability to Other Pets refers to how friendly and affectionate a cat is towards other pets, whether neighbors or outsiders.
Litterbox Comfortability + Adjustment refers to how comfortable and trained a cat is with using the litter box.
Healthy Grooming refers to how normal and healthy a cat\'s grooming habits are.
Age/Life Expectancy refers to how many more years the cat is expected to live.
Popularity refers to how popular the cat is, based on the Most Popular Breeds in the World according to Cat Time.
With respect to Activity/Playfulness
With respect to Calmness
With respect to Non-Aggression
With respect to Sociability to Humans
With respect to Sociability to Other Pets
With respect to Litterbox Comfortability + Adjustment
With respect to Healthy Grooming
